While we‚Äôre seeing a minor reactionary bounce, traders should remain extremely cautious. On-chain data suggests a massive "liquidity pocket" still sits just below this level, which usually acts as a magnet for a final sweep before any real trend reversal.   With the broader market structure remaining bearish, this bounce has all the hallmarks of a "bull trap." Explore the Classic Zone on Lista Lending

The Classic Zone is the core hub for standard lending and borrowing on @BNBCHAIN. While zones like Alpha, Aster, or CDP focus on specific niches, the Classic Zone is built specifically for blue-chips, PTs and stablecoins.

How to use it: 
üîπ Passive Earn: Supply assets to earn interest from the borrowers.
üîπ Unlock Liquidity: Collateralize your BNB, BTCB, or others without selling your bags. 
üîπ Looping Strategies: Utilise different yield baring assets and low borrowing rates on Lista

Know your numbers:
1Ô∏è‚É£ LLTV: The maximum you can borrow relative to your collateral. 
LTV = Total Borrowed Value / Total Collateral Value

2Ô∏è‚É£ Borrow Rates: The Borrow Rate is the annualized cost you pay for your loan. It is fully automated and determined entirely by the market, ensuring fair pricing for both borrowers and suppliers.

Binance updated its Proof of Reserves this week, tweaking how net user balances are calculated to make the 1:1 backing clearer and less confusing.

The latest January snapshot shows reserves sitting above 100% for major assets:
$BNB at 100.87%, $BTC 100.06%, $ETH 100.00%, and $USDT 101.69%. In simple terms, onchain holdings continue to exceed user balances.

The methodology change is about tightening how those numbers are presented, not about changing how funds are held. Users can still verify their own balances through the PoR system using Merkle proofs and zkSNARKs.

It‚Äôs another step in the post FTX push toward transparency. Most reactions look positive so far, with a few people still asking for full third party audits, which is a familiar debate in crypto.
